hi and welcome you listening to the x22
report my name is Dave and this is
episode 1314 a and today's date is June
23rd 2017 and the plot of the episode is
everything is in place a Fed unwind is
the last step this is the warning let's
get into the economic collapse financial
news now in the past couple of years
we've been seeing our politicians out
there pushing the idea that everyone
needs to get a raise they need to
continually raise minimum wage and yes
this does help in the short run the
problem is is that with technology and
everything that is changing right now as
we keep raising the minimum wage the
corporations are going to turn to
automation they're going to move away
from paying individual people and we see
this happening right now now we need to
go to the root of the problem the value
of the dollar continually decreases
which makes the purchasing power of the
dollar decrease which means there's
inflation which we are seeing and this
is why you continually need to raise the
minimum wage because as you're set at a
certain rate and the value of the dollar
continually decreases you can't live
anymore
that's why the older generation who are
on a fixed rate right now when food goes
up when rent goes up or anything else
health health insurance goes up they
need to take a part-time job because
their fixed income cannot work with the
devaluation of the dollar now what's
happening here is that corporations
right now like McDonald's they are
turning towards like these food service
ATM machines so instead of paying
someone $15 an hour they will purchase
these machines they don't have to worry
about workman's compensation they don't
have to worry about scheduling hours
they don't have to worry about someone
being sick because the machine is always
there yes a machine will break down
but they still have other machines that
are there take your order we're already
seeing this in many of the department
stores many of the home building type of
environments like Home Depot or Walmart
where you have self checkout and
everything is turning this way where
individuals will no longer help you
you'll just go to the Machine and you'll
do everything yourself because what is
happening we're at that point where it's
not cost-effective anymore and this
system needs to go away because again we
could see throughout the country with
all the regulations and devaluation of
the dollar corporations they're not
staying in America they've been leaving
and this trend is continuing even though
Trump is out there and he's promising
manufacturing is coming back he's
promising jobs are coming back this will
not happen until the reset occurs and
that's what all these promises are about
that they will come back to the US if he
and others can make things right here
now again this is their plan this is
what they want to do we'll have to see
if it pans out now today the new home
sales those figures came out the
corporate media is out there saying no
everything's bouncing back new home
sales are up 2.9 percent
everything looks fantastic now remember
back in April they plunged by eleven
point four percent they were revised as
a seven point nine percent drop instead
of eleven point four percent drop and
when we look at this we can say well
this whole new home sale reporting well
it kind of borders on fake news now we
need to remember new home sales
represent about 10% of total home sales
now today's report when we look at it
and this is coming from the Census
Bureau report that new home sales
increased by 2.9 percent over April yet
at the 90 percent level of confidence
new home sales might have been anywhere
from down by 10 percent to up to 15
percent most likely it's probably in the
downward side but remember April's
number was revised upward by 24,000 now
make matters worse new home sales are
based on contracts signed often a down
payment and almost always financing are
not yet in place the contract
cancellation percentage rate for new
homes typically runs in the mid to
high-teens
by the way the Census Bureau does not
incorporate cancellations into its data
or its historical revisions to
demonstrate how the seasonal adjustment
magically transformed monthly data into
many more thousands of annualized rate
sales consider this the not seasonally
adjusted number which is presented at
the bottom of the Seabees report and
never discussed by the media or Wall
Street is 58 thousand an increase of one
thousand homes over April's not adjusted
number and yet the reported headline and
maybe we can consider this fake news
wants us to believe that six hundred and
ten thousand homes were sold on an
annualized rate basis an increase of
seventeen thousand over April it's
nothing short of idiotic especially
considering the reported average sales
price was ten percent higher in May
verse April now if today's reported
number is even remotely correct how come
home builders had been cutting back on
housing starts for the last three months
the last time starts declined three
consecutive month with late 2008 the new
home sales report for May is in all
probability fake news and we can see
this is what they do they manipulate the
numbers to make it look like things are
a lot better than they are
and we can see that they've been doing
this for a very long time to keep the
illusion that the economy's doing well
now tomorrow Saturday I'm going to be
uploading an interview with wolf Richter
now he breaks all this down and actually
he lays out how the economy is going to
come down he has two different scenarios
and one is a lot better than the other
but he doesn't know which one
going to play out but he can see that
all these bubbles retail and everything
else everything is completely falling
apart so tomorrow morning Saturday at
around 8:30 a.m. Eastern Standard Time
the video should be up there if you're
on the email alert system you'll get the
email if not just go to youtube type in
external reports spotlight you'll be
able to listen to and watch the video or
you can come over to the x-22 report
comm site go to steam it any of these
places and you can watch the video now
the Fed came out and they did an annual
stress test and they said there are 34
banks that they tested they they will
survive a recession everything looks
great and we know that these stress
tests they're pretty much fake phony and
false it's to make us feel a lot better
since the 2008 crisis remember what
happens each time there's a major crisis
go back in 1929 all of a sudden we had
insurance for the deposits because no
one trusted the banks because people
lost a lot of money after 2008 what
happened people didn't trust the banking
system so they said okay we're going to
set up stress tests plus your deposits
are insured up to 250,000 dollars to
make people feel like your money is safe
except they created the beylin documents
which they're just going to take your
money from inside the bank
so is your currency inside the bank's
really safe
not really so they did the stress test
and they're out there you know parading
around saying that if there is any type
of recession any type of depression
don't worry these banks they are strong
and they will be able to ride out the
storm the problem is is the Fed has a
problem with the credit card debt and
this is generally the most expensive and
risky debt for consumers has now moved
to the top of the feds worry list in the
severely adverse scenario of the stress
test the projected losses for the 34
largest banks not counting the losses of
the 4,997 smaller banks are expected to
hit about a hundred
up nearly 9% from the stress test a year
ago now the projected losses rose for
several reasons including that the
credit card balances well they've grown
by 5.6 percent from a year ago to over a
trillion dollars the delinquency rate
has riven has risen to 2.4 percent now
another worry of the Fed is the
commercial and industrial loans whose
balances are over twice as large two
point one trillion dollars but whose
projected losses are also pegged at a
hundred billion in total the severely
advanced scenario sees about 493 billion
in losses for these 34 banks now you
know this number is going to be triple
of what they're reporting when the
losses start actually the probably in
the trillions and we can see that right
now that this has been put together to
make us believe that the banks are
strong now what we are seeing is that
the Fed is preparing and getting ready
for this collapse scenario and this is
why they're coming out with all this now
what's very interesting about this is
that st. Louis Fed President James
Bullard he is out there saying listen
maybe we shouldn't raise the interest
rates maybe we should wait and see how
the economic developments and
Washington's policies play out in the
coming quarters maybe we should just
freeze everything to see what Trump does
because right now Trump hasn't really
done nothing in the economy they passed
a budget that will last until September
30th they have the debt ceiling crisis
still which is still there and the Fed
right now is raising interest rates and
most likely certain parts of the economy
have been triggered and things are
starting to rapidly fall apart which
we've been seeing now remember the Fed
now is going to start to unwind their
balance sheet now remember the bull
markets they're driven by new capital
you need more money for more buyers to
increase buying pressure so the stock
prices rise
and it looks as though globally
investors are tapped out after months of
new capital pouring into the market
global equity fund inflows slowed
dramatically last week and not just a
little by a lot now this is a major
warning sign throw in the fact that the
Fed is now both raising rates and
draining liquidity from the markets and
there is their recipe for a serious
market disruption to hit now the Fed has
now announced that rather than
continuing to reinvest the proceeds from
its maturing debt securities going
forward every month it will let ten
billion six billion in Treasuries and
four billion in mortgage-backed
securities come due and not reinvest the
money put another way going forward the
Fed will be withdrawing ten billion in
liquidity from the financial system
every month now this amount will
increase by another ten billion next
quarter bringing the monthly withdrawal
to 20 billion and another 10 billion the
following quarter put simply according
to the current plan withdrawing 90
billion in liquidity in 2017 withdrawing
five hundred and ten billion in
liquidity in 2018 and this marks the
first time in eight years that the Fed
will not be actively providing liquidity
to the US markets will this mark the top
of the latest stock market bubble well
we'll have to see what happens we know
that the markets are completely
manipulated we know the central banks
have been buying a lot of the tech
stocks pumping all of this up we know
the Fed has been feeding the market and
again we'll have to watch to see how
this all plays out now we know that
raising the interest rates we know
they're unwinding this is a sure sign
that they are getting ready for the next
economic crisis that is going to happen
because they know the next one is going
to be the big one and it looks like
they're cleaning house right now to make
room to bring on more toxic assets
we know these bubbles around the country
all these housing bubbles and everything
else they're all going to pop now
remember a lot of this market that we
are in today is one gigantic illusion a
lot of these houses are owned by
investment companies speculators hedge
funds foreign investors they're not
owned by people so they're just going to
leave them who cares they're just going
to say ok I'm out the American people
they've been sitting on the sidelines
and the stock market well this has been
completely manipulated the central banks
are in the market who's going to take
the fall for all of this think about it
for a second when it comes down it's
going to be horrific there's no one else
to pump this back up I mean yes the
central bank can start stimulus once
again which most likely they will and of
course what they're waiting for is Trump
to set forth some type of policy because
if they keep going the way they're going
and I think what happened now is they
notice that their interest rate hikes
has triggered certain economic sectors
and they're starting to deteriorate very
very quickly they're saying ok let's
hold up right now let's just wait a
second let's see what Trump does because
our ultimate goal here is to blame him
now if you notice he really hasn't done
anything and I think this is on purpose
because this way the central bank is
trapped if he does absolutely nothing to
the economy and leaves it just the way
Obama left it and let's the central bank
do everything he can turn around and say
hey was it me this was all you you're
the one who said raise the interest
rates you're the one who said I'm going
to unwind my balance sheet this is
Obama's economy and if you notice Trump
he might seem like he's this fool that's
running around doing crazy things I
think this is what he wants the
corporate media to believe I think he
this is what he wants the Fed to believe
I think he wants everyone to believe
that this is how it is because again his
greatest strength is to make everyone
think one thing and do another member
he's been in business for a very long
time he understands bankruptcy he
understands the game maybe he doesn't
understand the political game but it
looks like he's getting that knowledge
very very quickly and he did a fast one
on Comey but we can see right now he is
a businessman he knows how to maneuver
around these individuals he knows how to
play with them he understands what needs
to be done and you can see right now
this is exactly what he's doing and like
I said there is a race to gain the
narrative if you noticed with the case
of Comey who gained the narrative Trump
with the case of the economy coming down
he hasn't done anything
we said this from the beginning he will
own the narrative the Fed did everything
that Fed raised the race the Fed was
starting to unwind the Fed said that we
have to do this we come off of Obama's
economy who was supposed to be strong
and robust I haven't touched it it's all
falling apart this is what he is pushing
right now they don't see it I mean
Bullard is out there saying well wait a
minute we're moving too fast there he's
not doing anything and you can see
already they're getting nervous about
what is about to happen and that is the
economy is about to come down
listen everyone thanks a lot for
